title: Student Council Candidates
question_text:
Jeff sends everyone in his high school a survey asking which of three student council candidates his peers will support. Out of $1{,}300\text{ students}$, $403$ returned completed surveys.
What is the biggest problem with Jeffâ€™s survey technique?

choices.text: Undercoverage is clearly present in this survey.
He did not ensure that males and females were equally represented in the response.
The data may exhibit non-response bias.
He should have done a matched pair analysis.
He did not talk to the respondents in person.

solution:
The data clearly has non-response bias, as only $403\text{ students}$ responded out of the $1{,}300$ total, meaning $897\text{ students}$ did not respond.

Non-response is a potential problem in every sample because the group of students who chose to respond to the poll may have different political views than the students who chose not to respond. Jeff did not get a random sample.
